DOC.brief_title: Collaborative Targeted Case Management Improving Functional Status Patients With Stage III-IV Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Establish comparative effectiveness Collaborative Care Preserve Performance Cancer ( COPE ) trial arm preserve functional status . II . To assess comparative cost-effectiveness cost-utility COPE intervention . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 3 arm . ARM I : Patients undergo enhance usual care comprise telephonic monitoring , monthly status report , oncology care team 6 month . ARM II : Patients undergo enhance usual care Arm I participate individualized conditioning program deliver local physical therapist coordinate Rehabilitation Care Manager ( RCM ) 6 month . ARM III : Patients undergo enhance usual care Arm I , participate individualized conditioning program coordinate RCM Arm II , receive optimize pain management Pain Care Manager ( PCM ) 6 month .
